definition: see 愛面子|爱面子[ai4 mian4 zi5]
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)
pinyin: si3 yao4 mian4 zi5 huo2 shou4 zui4

sentences.english: It is a question of pride as much as anything else.
sentences.chinese: 很重要的一個原因就是要面子罷了。

sentences.english: He refused to accept help out of a false sense of pride.
sentences.chinese: 他由於死要面子而不肯承受協助。

sentences.english: Man be keen on face-saving after all.
sentences.chinese: 男人嘛畢竟都是要面子的。

sentences.english: The trouble with governors is, they think they gotta keep their dignity.
sentences.chinese: 所有州長的毛病就是死要面子。

sentences.english: She believed Chen's behavior implied that he cared too much about dignity, which was a little horrible.
sentences.chinese: 她認爲陳利的做法是太要面子的表現，讓人覺得恐怖。

definition: to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)
pinyin: si3 yao4 mian4 zi5 huo2 shou4 zui4

definition: to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5
